title: Ryder Cup 2025: Best moments from Day 1
content: Team USA looks to take the Ryder Cup back from Team Europe at Bethpage Black. We have the best moments from the first day of action.

title: Lakers leave future up to LeBron, extend Redick
content: While LeBron James enters his eighth season with the Lakers in a contract year, coach JJ Redick's future with the team is clear after being signed to an extension.

title: L. Paul sues auction house over MJ-signed court
content: Logan Paul has filed an injunction against Heritage Auctions, saying he was not allowed to investigate the authenticity of a Michael Jordan-signed piece of United Center floor that Paul won at auction.

title: Lindor makes history as Mets make playoff push
content: Francisco Lindor reached the 30-30 mark for the second time in his career when he homered as the Mets captured a big series win over the Cubs.

title: Raleigh meets fan who gave 60th HR ball to boy
content: The fan who gave a 12-year-old boy Cal Raleigh's 60th home run ball Wednesday night in Seattle returned to T-Mobile Park on Thursday and was gifted a signed Raleigh bat and two baseball -- which he gave to his kids.

title: Seahawks sing Darnold's praises after GW drive
content: Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald raved about Sam Darnold's poise after the quarterback led the team down the field for a game-winning field goal Thursday night against the Cardinals.

title: Cards' Harrison flops early, lights up 4th with TD
content: Cardinals receiver Marvin Harrison took a knee to celebrate his late touchdown catch, the highlight of an up-and-down Thursday night in which he was the target on both of Kyler Murray's interceptions.

title: 'Weight lifted': Tigers top Guardians, tie for 1st
content: Detroit snapped an eight-game losing streak, beating Cleveland to move back into a tie with the Guardians atop the American League Central with three games to play.

title: Bryson-Thomas to lead off U.S. team at Ryder Cup
content: Bryson DeChambeau and Justin Thomas will be paired in the the first match of foursomes (alternate-shot) at the Ryder Cup on Friday at Bethpage Black as captains for the respective teams unveiled their morning groups.

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

content: There's still a lot at stake entering the final weekend of the regular season. We have your guide to the last few days of baseball before October.

content: Here's everything you need to know for Week 4 NFL games. Which teams will win, who are the X factors, and which storylines matter most?

title: How a road rally in mid-August catapulted the Fever to the WNBA semifinals
content: Down by 19. Sophie Cunningham had just exited with an injury. How the Fever responded turned around their season.

title: From The Big Dumper to ... magic? Why Mariners might have the mojo to finally win it all
content: Seattle has never won a World Series. Or even an American League pennant. Could a little bit of magic change that?

title: 'This season he is better than ever': Haaland is becoming the complete striker for Man City
content: The goals are still flowing for Erling Haaland, but his growth as a leader and an all-around contributor has made him invaluable to Pep Guardiola and Manchester City.

title: Liverpool's Chiesa is 'here to win' and now has the chance to prove it
content: Federico Chiesa has struggled at times after moving to Liverpool, but he has a chance to reignite his career.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 4: Elic Ayomanor, Chargers D/ST among top options
content: Do injuries have you seeking a late-week pickup? Need a defense to stream? We have options with favorable setups.

content: In March 2022, Seattle traded away Russell Wilson, altering the franchise's path. Let's reevaluate that move, plus 22 others from 2022-23.

title: Micah Parsons' hobby? Beating Packers teammates at HORSE, pingpong and bowling
content: "We just building relationships," Parsons said of competing with his new teammates ahead of Sunday's return to Dallas.

title: Shedeur Sanders on being Browns' No. 3 QB: 'I'm thankful for my situation'
content: The rookie tells ESPN he's "10 times more comfortable in this space" now than when he began with the offense.

title: Stanley Cup contender rankings: Who dethrones the Panthers, Oilers?
content: It's been the same Cup Final matchup in consecutive years. Here are the teams that can change that in 2025-26.

content: With opening night approaching on Oct. 7, we take big swings on what will transpire for each team this season.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Fever, Lynx take 1-0 leads in semifinals
content: The 2025 WNBA semifinals are underway, and Phoenix beat Minnesota in OT in an instant classic Tuesday.

content: Who has the edge at UFC Fight Night from Perth, Australia? MMA analysts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Ranking boxing fights: Fundora-Thurman, Parker-Wardley, more
content: From Sebastian Fundora's title bout, to the junior middleweight debut of "Boots" Ennis, ESPN picks October's best fights.

title: Penn State RBs Nicholas Singleton and Kaytron Allen doing record things
content: Despite scouts placing the pair in the first two days of the NFL draft, they returned for one more year.

title: 'Our tradition to is to be untraditional': Inside the lifecycle of an Oregon uniform
content: Throughout the past two and a half decades, Oregon has pushed the envelope when it comes to uniforms.

title: Ranking every World Cup mascot: From World Cup Willie to Maple, Zayu and Clutch
content: Now that the 2026 World Cup mascots have been revealed, ESPN ranks every competition's mascot from worst to first dating back to 1966.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool look to Bayern's Upamecano
content: Liverpool are lining up a move for Bayern Munich center back Dayot Upamecano. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: OL Lyonnes have spent big to reclaim UWCL title, but will it cause issues?
content: OL Lyonnes have won the UEFA Women's Champions League eight times, but have not won it since 2022. After a summer of spending, how will they jell?

title: West Virginia, Boise State lead best uniforms from college football Week 5
content: West Virginia will don a look that throws things back all the way to 1965, while Boise State is making waves with incredibly detailed, hand-painted helmets.

title: Alonso's first F1 title, 20 years later: 'He was just another level'
content: Twenty years after winning his first F1 championship, Fernando Alonso is still on the grid, still revered, and still hungry for another world title.

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Inside Trump's Quite Takeover Of Silicon Valley
content: Since President Trump was sworn in earlier this year, his administration has steadily eroded the corporate autonomy of US Big Tech players.

title: Videos Show Lashkar Building Terror Camp In New Area After Indian Strikes In May
content: There is fresh evidence of Pakistan's continued patronage of cross-border terrorism. The Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), a UN-designated terrorist group responsible for the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, is building a sprawling terror training centre.

title: H-1B: The Visa That Links Musk, Nadella And Pichai's Rise In US
content: The H-1B visa has helped highly skilled professionals from across the world to advance America's technology sector. Three stalwarts who have made an indelible mark in the US after obtaining an H-1B visa are, Elon Musk, Sundar Pichai and Satya Nadella

title: Russia To Build Four New Nuclear Power Plants In Iran For $25 Billion
content: Iran and Russia signed a $25 billion deal to build nuclear power plants in the Islamic republic, Iranian state media reported Friday, just hours ahead of the likely return of sweeping UN sanctions on Iran.

title: 'I Love Muhammad' Row Escalates In UP, Clashes In Bareilly, Cops Lathicharge
content: Police launched a lathicharge to counter reported stone pelting by protestors after Friday prayers in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, the latest stand-off in a row that began weeks ago over an 'I Love Muhammad' poster.

title: EU Cites Trade Deal Immunity As Trump Hits Pharma With 100% Tariff
content: US President Donald Trump's announcement of steep new tariffs on medicines and other goods drew pushback from some allies on Friday, with the EU claiming immunity for its pharmaceutical industry under an earlier trade deal.

title: Sonam Wangchuk Arrest Live Updates: Internet Services Suspended In Leh After Sonam Wangchuk's Arrest
content: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk was arrested by police on Friday and according to government sources, he has been charged under the stringent National Security Act (NSA).

title: India Records 56 Lakh Foreign Tourist Arrivals Till August In 2025
content: India recorded approximately 56 lakh foreign tourist arrivals (FTAs) till August this year, along with 303.59 crore domestic tourist visits, according to official data released on Friday.

title: Sonam Wangchuk Arrested Under Stringent NSA, Taken To Undisclosed Location
content: Ladakh statehood activist Sonam Wangchuk, who faces allegations of inciting a mob with provocative statements, has been arrested a day after he said he would be "happy to be arrested anytime for this cause".

title: No Sanctions On Purchasing Crude Oil From Russia: Hardeep Puri
content: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri on Friday said that there are no sanctions on the purchase of Russian crude oil, and the world will face serious consequences if the supplies are disrupted.

title: 5-Year-Old Boy Mauled To Death By Leopard In Maharashtra
content: A five-year-old boy was mauled to death by a leopard in a village in Maharashtra's Gondia district, a forest official said on Friday.

title: What India Said On Proposed Changes To H1-B Visa Selection Process
content: The government is aware of the one-month public comment period before the final rules are drafted for overhauling the H1-B visa lottery system, the Foreign Ministry has said.

title: Portugal's Azores Islands on Red Alert As Cyclone Gabrielle Causes Damage, Schools Remain Closed
content: Cyclone Gabrielle hit Portugal's mid-Atlantic Azores Islands on Friday with less intense winds and rains than expected, but still toppled trees and collapsed roofs, authorities said.

title: Madras High Court Issues Notice To Actor Vijay Over TVK Party Flag
content: The Madras High Court on Friday issued notice to Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) leader Vijay on an appeal filed by the Chennai-based trust Thondai Mandala Saandror Dharma Paribalana Sabai.

title: "Entirely Baseless": India Rejects NATO Chief's Claim On PM-Putin Discussion
content: Rubbishing NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte's claim that, after Donald Trump imposed a penalty on India for buying Russian oil, PM Narendra Modi is asking Vladimir Putin to "explain his strategy" on Ukraine, India has termed it baseless.

title: White Dwarf Gobbles Up Nitrogen-Rich Ices of Pluto-Like World
content: Astronomers have observed a white dwarf, a highly compact stellar ember, that appears to have gobbled up an icy world akin to dwarf planet Pluto, a finding with implications regarding the likelihood of habitable planets beyond our solar system

title: "Sirst", "Riks": Pakistan Minister's Verbal Slips At UN Council Go Viral
content: Pakistan Defence Minister Khawaja Asif repeatedly fumbled while discussing AI and Indo-Pak tensions at the United Nations Security Council (UNSC).

title: Could Earth Face An Asteroid Collision In 2025? Nostradamus' Old Warning
content: A massive asteroid may collide with Earth in 2025, according to predictions by the famous 16th-century French astrologer Nostradamus.

title: Nitish Katara Murder: Top Court Rejects Vikas Yadav's Plea To Extend Interim Bail
content: The Supreme Court on Friday refused to extend the interim bail of convict Vikas Yadav, currently serving a 25-year jail term in the 2002 Nitish Katara murder case.

title: 10-Year-Old Autistic Girl Crushed To Death In Broken Bed, Parents Arrested
content: A Minnesota couple have been charged with manslaughter after their 10-year-old daughter with autism allegedly died by getting trapped underneath her bed.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Battle for No. 1: Draisaitl, Pastrnak and the players to consider
content: Six players have a chance at being the No. 1 pick in fantasy hockey drafts, and we look at each one is deserving.

title: Asia Cup: ICC punishes Rauf for 'aggressive gestures', warns Farhan; SKY fined
content: Suryakumar Yadav and Haris Rauf each received a 30% match fee fine from the ICC for their on-field conduct during the Asia Cup India vs Pakistan matches. Rauf was penalised for aggressive gestures towards fans, while Yadav was fined for expressing solidarity with terror victims. Sahibzada Farhan also received a warning for his celebration.

title: 'Unwarranted': India pulls up Turkey's Erdogan over UN speech; what triggered row?
content: India strongly rejected Turkish President Erdogan's "objectionable" remarks on Jammu and Kashmir at the UNGA, reiterating it's a strictly bilateral issue with Pakistan requiring no third-party mediation. New Delhi lodged a strong protest, emphasizing that such statements on India's territorial integrity are unacceptable. India also highlighted Pakistan's cross-border terrorism as the root cause of the problem.

title: Netanyahu speaks at UN: Many delegations walk out - what Israel PM said
content: Benjamin Netanyahu maintained his defiant stance on continuing military action in Gaza at the UN General Assembly, despite increasing international isolation and a significant delegate walkout. He condemned nations recognizing Palestinian statehood and broadcasted his demands to Gaza residents, linking peace to hostage return and Hamas's disarmament, while facing mounting global pressure and war crimes allegations.

title: Apple‚Äôs supplier under scrutiny; staff allege tough conditions, company responds
content: Chinese workers at a Foxconn plant allegedly faced harsh conditions, including wage withholding and excessive 60-75 hour workweeks, during iPhone 17 production. China Labor Watch reported these issues, citing illegal temporary staff reliance and other abuses. Apple is investigating, while Foxconn emphasized worker safety.

title: 'I Love Muhammad' row: Protesters pelt stones; cops lathicharge in Bareilly
content: In Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh, police used lathi charge against Muslim protesters who engaged in stone pelting after Friday prayers. The demonstration, organized by cleric Maulana Tauqeer Raza over "I Love Muhammad" poster controversy, saw authorities conducting a flag march and deploying heavy security to maintain order. The cleric warned that the protest would proceed regardless of permission.

title: Sonam Wangchuk arrested: Activist moved out of Ladakh; internet suspended
content: Leh Police arrested activist Sonam Wangchuk following the cancellation of his NGO's license amidst escalating tensions in Ladakh. Protests demanding statehood and Sixth Schedule safeguards turned violent, resulting in casualties and widespread unrest. Wangchuk, who was on a hunger strike, called it off after fellow protesters were hospitalized, triggering further demonstrations and clashes with security forces.

title: ‚ÄòOrder Cancelled‚Äô: Flipkart users allege ‚Äòmisleading‚Äô iPhone 16; shares screenshots
content: Flipkart's Big Billion Days 2025 sale is embroiled in controversy following widespread cancellations and delays of smartphone orders, particularly the iPhone 16. Customers, who paid for discounted devices, report abrupt cancellations or stuck orders, sparking outrage on social media.

title: 'One India': Canada gets clear message from Delhi; Khalistan threat in focus
content: Canada and India are working to mend strained relations, focusing on mutual security concerns like terrorism and transnational crime. Nathalie Drouin's recent visit to India and meeting with Ajit Doval signal a renewed commitment to bilateral dialogue.

title: Harjit Kaur deportation: India responds to return of Sikh grandma
content: The MEA reported that over 2,400 Indian nationals have been deported from the US since January 2025, emphasizing India's stance against illegal migration while promoting legal pathways. Among those deported was Harjit Kaur, a 73-year-old woman who had resided in the US for over 30 years. Her case garnered significant attention due to the circumstances of her arrest and deportation, which she described as harrowing.

title: IND-PAK row reaches women's WC! Harmanpreet Kaur says 'we don't talk about it'
content: Harmanpreet Kaur is set to lead India in the ICC Women‚Äôs ODI World Cup at home, emphasizing enjoyment over pressure. The team is focused on cricket, especially in the context of the anticipated match against Pakistan. Alyssa Healy acknowledges India's strength in home conditions, while other captains share their strategies and expectations for the tournament.

title: Top H‚Äë1B employers in 2025 : Amazon, Microsoft, Meta & others - check list
content: Amazon secured the most H-1B visa approvals in the first half of 2025, followed by TCS, Microsoft, Meta, and Apple. These tech giants utilize the program to employ skilled professionals in specialized roles.

title: IND vs PAK: 'If we get Abhishek Bachchan out early' - Akhtar's remark goes viral
content: During a cricket talk show, Shoaib Akhtar's humorous slip of the tongue, mistaking cricketer Abhishek Sharma for Bollywood actor Abhishek Bachchan, went viral. This blooper occurred while discussing Pakistan's chances against India in the Asia Cup final, adding a lighthearted moment amidst the high-pressure atmosphere. The incident highlights the deep connection between Bollywood and cricket in South Asian culture.

title: 'Examining impact': India's first response to 100% pharma tariffs by US
content: India is closely monitoring the potential impact of the US's proposed tariffs of up to 100% on imported branded and patented pharmaceutical drugs, set to begin October 1. The relevant ministries are examining the matter, recognizing the US as India's largest pharma export market, accounting for approximately $10 billion in FY25.

title: IND-PAK final: Akhtar turns astrologer; calls it a 'bad day for India'
content: Shoaib Akhtar predicts India's downfall in the Asia Cup final against Pakistan, emphasizing the need for Pakistan to maintain their hunger from the Super Fours win. He believes Pakistan's bowling attack, especially with a strong pace attack, can trouble India if they set a good target. He also said that a "bad day" is coming for them and it has to be on Sunday.

title: Heartfelt! Sachin pens note on Bird's demise: 'He made the game richer'
content: Cricket world mourns the loss of Harold 'Dickie' Bird, the iconic umpire, who passed away at 92. Sachin Tendulkar led tributes, recalling Bird's fairness and humour. Yorkshire County Cricket Club honoured his legacy of sportsmanship. Bird, a former cricketer, officiated 66 Tests and 69 ODIs, becoming a beloved figure known for his quirks and respected by players for his impartiality.

title: Rise and Fall host Ashneer Grover receives 'invite' to join Bigg Boss 19 as wild card contestant
content: Ashneer Grover, host of 'Rise and Fall', reignited his feud with Salman Khan by sharing a screenshot of a fake Bigg Boss 19 wildcard invitation. He mocked Salman, suggesting the email was a 'mail merge' error and that Bigg Boss felt threatened. This follows past conflicts where Salman criticized Grover for false claims, and Grover accused Salman of overshadowing contestants.

title: HC rules deportation illegal: Centre told to bring back families from B'desh in a month
content: The Calcutta HC overturned the central government's deportation order for two women and their families. These families were from Birbhum, West Bengal. The court declared the deportation illegal. It ordered the return of all six individuals, including three children, to India within a month. The families had been deported on suspicion of being Bangladeshi nationals.

title: Ousmane Demb√©l√© net worth 2025: PSG star‚Äôs salary, career and family
content: Ousmane Demb√©l√©'s star shines brightly in 2025, boasting a $35 million net worth and a lucrative PSG contract. His remarkable season culminated in a Ballon d'Or win and a Champions League title. Endorsements with Adidas and other brands contribute significantly to his income, solidifying his status as a top earner both on and off the field.

title: Reducing Russian crude: India wants US to allow oil from Iran
content: Indian representatives have told the Trump administration that significant cuts in Russian oil imports would require access to alternative crude from sanctioned nations like Iran and Venezuela. During discussions in the US, the Indian delegation reiterated concerns that blocking access to oil from these producers could trigger global price increases.

title: Maoists allege 'fake encounter'; claim police arrested CC members, then killed them
content: Following a reported encounter in Abujhmarh forest, a dispute has erupted between Chhattisgarh police and the CPI (Maoist). The police claim to have killed two central committee members, but the Maoist outfit alleges a "fake encounter," asserting that the commanders were arrested beforehand. Police refuted the allegations, suggesting the Maoist statement is a reaction to check police response.

title: Who is Andressa Jones? Wife of Jonathan Jones' and woman behind his success
content: Jonathan Jones, NFL cornerback, has a supportive wife, Andressa Jones. She is a mother and entrepreneur. Andressa owns Joyville Indoor Playground in Massachusetts. The amusement center is under construction. Andressa and Jonathan met online in 2021. They married in Florida in March 2022. Andressa attends Patriots games with their children. She supports Jonathan's career.

title: ‚ÄòWill make tougher to work illegally‚Äô: UK to introduce digital ID for workers - How it will work
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer has revealed plans for a free digital ID system for nationals and residents, aiming to curb illegal immigration and simplify access to government services. The digital ID, stored on smartphones, will streamline applications for various services and be mandatory for proving the right to work.

title: Salman Khan opens up about his battle with neurological disorder trigeminal neuralgia
content: The trigeminal nerve which runs through the face, becomes the target of chronic pain in patients who have TN. The trigeminal nerve divides into three sections that transmit sensory information to the forehead, cheek, jaw and eye areas. The trigeminal nerve experiences irritation or compression which results in brief, yet intense electric shock-like pain that affects only one side of the face

title: IND A vs AUS A: Highest chase ever! KL Rahul‚Äôs 176 powers India to record win
content: KL Rahul's magnificent, unbeaten 176 propelled India A to a historic victory against Australia A in the second Unofficial Test, securing the series 1-0. India A chased down a record 412, the highest ever by an 'A' side, surpassing Australia A's previous record.

title: UP doctors remove 29 spoons, 19 toothbrushes, 2 pens from man‚Äôs stomach
content: Surgeons in Hapur were astonished to discover 29 steel spoons, 19 toothbrushes, and two pens inside a 40-year-old man's stomach during an emergency surgery. The patient, admitted to a Ghaziabad de-addiction center, complained of severe abdominal pain.

title: 'Paper chor': Rahul's new attack after 'vote chori' charge; points to exam leaks
content: Rahul Gandhi has accused the BJP government of being a "paper chor" amid rising outrage over examination leaks, particularly the UKSSSC paper leak in Uttarakhand. He linked the issue to his earlier allegations of "vote chori," arguing that unemployment and electoral malpractice are connected. Gandhi declared his support for protesting students, calling the crisis a fight for justice and democracy.

title: Market crash: Sensex down over 700 points - top 5 reasons for dip
content: Stock market today: While Nifty50 went below 24,700, BSE Sensex was down over 700 points. Nifty50 closed the day at 24,654.70, down 236 points or 0.95%. BSE Sensex was at 80,426.46, down 733 points or 0.90%.

title: Study reveals offshore wind farm cables affect female crabs and marine ecosystems
content: Research indicates that subsea cables from offshore wind farms, while crucial for clean energy, emit electromagnetic fields affecting marine life. Female shore crabs are particularly vulnerable, exhibiting altered behaviour near cables, which disrupts their migrations and breeding. These disruptions could cascade through coastal food chains, highlighting the need for smarter planning and mitigation strategies in offshore energy development.

title: War of words! Kaif responds to Bumrah: 'Take it as an observation'
content: A debate sparked between Mohammad Kaif and Jasprit Bumrah after Kaif questioned Bumrah's workload management during the Asia Cup, particularly under Suryakumar Yadav's captaincy. Bumrah sharply refuted Kaif's observations on social media. Kaif responded calmly, framing his remarks as a well-wisher's perspective, emphasizing Bumrah's crucial role for India, particularly in high-profile games.

title: Serena Williams celebrates her 44th birthday with heartfelt tributes
content: Serena Williams, celebrating her 44th birthday on September 26, 2025, is honored by fans worldwide for her legendary tennis career. With 23 Grand Slam singles titles, she revolutionized the sport, inspiring millions and breaking barriers. Today, she thrives as a mother, entrepreneur, and role model, leaving a lasting impact beyond the court.

title: India-US trade pact: Big update on Goyal's visit; aim for 'early conclusion'
content: India and the US are committed to progressing towards a trade agreement, as stated by the Ministry of Commerce & Industry. During Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's visit to the US, both sides discussed potential aspects of the deal and agreed to continue discussions for a mutually beneficial outcome.

title: Dentures ‚Äòyour fault‚Äô: What US authorities told 73-year old grandma when she refused ice
content: Harjit Kaur, a 73-year-old woman who lived in the US for 30 years, faced deportation after her asylum applications were denied. During her detention, she was allegedly denied proper medical care, food, and basic hygiene.

title: 'They didn‚Äôt want a Black character': Gabrielle Union on being rejected from movie
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, recently spoke about facing discrimination in Hollywood. She revealed being rejected for a role due to her ethnicity. Union wanted to be in 'Sugar and Spice' but was turned down. She also discussed beauty standards and how they affected her career. Despite challenges, Union has achieved success. Her marriage with Wade inspires many.

title: Teenager flees home abuse in UP, survives gang rape in Jaipur
content: A 15-year-old girl, fleeing abuse in Uttar Pradesh, endured gang rape in Jaipur, leading to the tragic delivery of a stillborn child. After escaping her stepfather's torment in Gorakhpur, she met Krishna in Ajmer, who brought her to Jaipur and allegedly assaulted her. Later, Krishna's friend, Bacchan, also repeatedly raped her.

title: No relief for Rahul: HC junks plea in Sikh row; Varanasi court to hear case
content: Rahul Gandhi's revision petition against a Varanasi MP/MLA Special Court order has been dismissed by the Allahabad High Court. The petition challenged the Special Court's acceptance of a complaint filed against him regarding remarks he made about Sikhs during a visit to the United States in September 2024. This legal challenge stems from the aftermath of his comments made abroad.

title: 'Dangerous alien': US arrests another 'illegal' Indian for multi-vehicle crash
content: Partap Singh, an undocumented Indian, was arrested after a multi-vehicle crash. The crash critically injured a five-year-old girl and her father. Homeland Security criticized California Governor Gavin Newsom for issuing Singh a commercial driver‚Äôs license. This is the second such case this year. Earlier, Harjinder Singh was charged with vehicular homicide in Florida.

title: Nia Jax reveals why she hid her family ties from WWE officials
content: Nia Jax, cousin of Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, initially concealed her Anoa‚Äôi family ties upon entering WWE. She aimed to prove her worth independently, participating in the first tryout at the NXT Performance Center. Jax has since become a prominent WWE performer, securing championships and earning respect for her perseverance, marking a unique journey built on her own merits.

title: Heart disease & leg pain: Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD) symptoms explained
content: Leg pain during walking could signal Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD), indicating clogged arteries and increased risk of heart attack and stroke. Early detection through tests like ABI is crucial, especially for those with risk factors such as smoking or diabetes. Addressing PAD through lifestyle changes and medical interventions can protect both legs and heart.

title: Watch: Man runs over ex-girlfriend with speeding scooter in Indore
content: In Indore's Heera Nagar, Rajendra Chaurasia allegedly ran over his ex-girlfriend with an Activa after she refused to reconcile. The incident occurred in Kalpana Nagar, following an argument where Rajendra insisted they live together. CCTV footage captured him speeding towards her, even as she tried to defend herself.

title: Martina Navratilova sparks row over Melania Trump‚Äôs viral look at Donald Trump
content: Martina Navratilova ignited controversy by commenting on Melania Trump's expression during the UN General Assembly in New York, suggesting she despises her husband. This followed Navratilova's criticism of Donald Trump's behavior at the US Open final, where she noted his lack of applause and the security delays caused by his presence, further highlighting her outspoken opposition to the former president.

title: Bangladesh paid the price vs Pakistan, will India regret catches dropped next?
content: Dropped catches proved costly for Bangladesh as Pakistan secured a spot in the Asia Cup final against India. Phil Simmons, Bangladesh coach, lamented the missed opportunities and poor batting decisions that led to their 11-run defeat. India's fielding has also been a concern, with 12 dropped catches in five matches.

title: 'Mark my words': Akhtar tells Pakistan how to beat India in Asia Cup final
content: Shoaib Akhtar believes Pakistan can defeat India in the Asia Cup 2025 final by dismissing Abhishek Sharma early and maintaining an aggressive mindset. Akhtar emphasized the importance of targeting Sharma in the initial overs, suggesting that his early dismissal could destabilize the Indian batting lineup. He also anticipates Gautam Gambhir will motivate India to bring their best game against Pakistan.

title: 'Averted catastrophe': Pakistan PM hails Trump as ‚Äòman of peace'
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif lauded Donald Trump as a "man of peace" for his role in facilitating a ceasefire between Pakistan and India, averting a potential catastrophe in South Asia. Sharif expressed deep admiration for Trump's efforts to end global conflicts and invited him to visit Pakistan.

title: Dhanteras 2025 Shubh Muhurat: When is the most auspicious time to buy Gold in UAE?
content: Indians in the UAE are gearing up for auspicious gold purchases with Pushya Nakshatra on October 14-15 and Dhanteras on October 18-19, 2025. Pushya Nakshatra, linked to Goddess Lakshmi, offers a 20-hour window for buying gold. Dhanteras extends the Muhurat for over 19 hours, favoring gold, silver, and utensil acquisitions.

title: Framework for hi-tech manufacturing in Kerala launched
content: The framework is aimed at transforming Kerala into a global hub of research and development, design and engineering, testing, certification and manufacturing in the manufacturing sector.

title: Rain hits normal life in southern Kerala
content: Apart from Thiruvananthapuram, heavy rain threw life out of gear in Pathanamthitta and Idukki districts. Roads and low-lying areas were flooded in the capital

title: TDP leader lauds Naidu and Lokesh for successful conduct of DSC examination
content: Nettem Raghuram praises swift completion of teacher recruitment within 150 days, highlighting transparency, social justice measures, and government commitment despite legal challenges

title: High drama as police thwart Sharmila‚Äôs bid to go to Andhra Pradesh Assembly on tractor
content: The APCC president insists on personally meeting Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu over the farmers‚Äô grievances, and accuses the government of neglecting their plight

title: Amid threats to Idukki‚Äôs cardamom sector, Forest dept. to take up reclassification of Bonnet macaques under Wildlife Act with Centre
content: As per department sources, Bonnet macaque is a Schedule I animal and without changing the status officials cannot intervene in the issue

title: Degree students stage protest in Shivamogga, Hassan over delay in appointing guest faculty
content: It seems that students would be forced to appear for semester exams even without attending classes on certain subjects

title: African Swine Fever confirmed in Thrissur, control measures stepped up
content: Rapid Response Team deployed; Minister J. Chinchurani hands over ‚Çπ8 lakh relief to pig farmer affected by a similar outbreak earlier

title: Man faces death sentence after court finds him guilty of rape and murder
content: The judge awards compensation of ‚Çπ10 lakh to the victim‚Äôs family from the District Legal Services Authority

title: Food streets set up in four places in Kerala
content: Each food street built at a cost of ‚Çπ1 crore in Thiruvananthapuram, Ernakulam, Malappuram, and Kozhikode. Scheme envisages a makeover of the street food scenario in Kerala and to serve it up as a new tourist attraction

title: Bidar wins Jal Sanchay Jan Bhagidari Award for water conservation programmes
content: The award is given to top performing¬†districts under the campaign, Jal Shakti Abhiyan: Catch the Rain; Bidar will get ‚Çπ25 lakh in cash

title: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly unanimously passes Bill to repeal NALA Act
content: It is aimed at improving the State‚Äôs ranking in the Ease-of-Doing Business and promoting overall economic growth, says Revenue Minister Satya Prasad

title: Karnataka to rationalise Mother and Child Health triad services to strengthen maternal healthcare across taluk hospitals
content: The move will ensure taluk hospitals function as Comprehensive Emergency Obstetric and Newborn Care (CEmONC) facilities, capable of handling complicated deliveries, Caesarean sections and newborn emergencies round the clock

title: Modern practices key to agricultural growth: Cheluvarayaswamy
content: The Minister has urged farmers to shift to scientifically improved modern varieties, which would lead to better yields and greater economic prosperity

title: Staff union accuses KTU V-C of bypassing Syndicate in legal counsel appointment
content: Confederation of University Employees Organisations that the advocate was paid ‚Çπ2.7 lakh outside statutory provisions and without proper scrutiny. Unions says the Syndicate had appointed a standing counsel a year ago

title: LDF fears wrangling in BJP over AIIMS location can imperil Kerala‚Äôs aspirations
content: Union Minister Suresh Gopi sparks off controversy over the location by suggesting either Alappuzha or Thrissur. He purportedly states that he ‚Äúcared less‚Äù if AIIMS goes to Tamil Nadu, if not for the two districts.  CPI(M) says the dispute in BJP over the location is the latest manifestation of the irreconcilable one-upmanship struggles plaguing that party in Kerala

title: State received 0.24L tonnes higher urea than allotment in September: Minister Tummala
content: Short-supply of urea for the ongoing Kharif season still remains high at 1.92L tonnes as on September 25

title: Collector, SP review arrangements for ‚ÄòBanni festival‚Äô in Kurnool
content: Officials estimate that over three lakh devotees will likely participate in the famous ‚ÄòDevaragattu Banni festival‚Äô, which will be celebrated on the night of Dasara in Devaragattu village

title: Custodial death case: SC tells Madhya Pradesh, CBI to arrest absconding police officers by October 7 or face contempt charges
content: The Bench warned that failure to meet the arrest deadline will invite contempt proceedings and require the State‚Äôs top bureaucrat and the CBI investigating officer to appear in court

title: Heritage Walk showcases Mysuru‚Äôs architectural treasures
content: The participants were explained about the various architectural styles of different structures, the age during which they were built, the history behind them etc.

title: 582 graduates, 17 postgraduates to receive degrees at SDMCET in Dharwad today
content: WALMI Director Girish Maraddi will deliver the 15th convocation address at SDM College of Engineering and Technology

title: 2,417 Indians deported from U.S. since January
content: MEA said India stands against illegal migration and it wants to promote pathways for legal mobility of people

title: New method in Pichavaram uses tidal fluctuations to improve the survival of mangrove saplings
content: A new tidal mangrove nursery at Killai holds around three lakh saplings. It is designed for the hardening of seedlings in natural tidal conditions, making them better suited for survival in coastal environments

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Entirely baseless: India on NATO chief's claims that Modi asked for Ukraine plan from Putin
content: ‚ÄúWe expect the leadership of an important institution like NATO to exercise greater responsibility and accuracy in public statements,‚Äù Randhir Jaiswal said

title: Railway Board directs zones to examine feasibility for installing bio-toilets in guard's coach
content: Since watering facilities are generally not available in goods yards, the present practice is to provide waterless urinals in brake vans

title: Show-cause notice aimed at silencing Malabar Devaswom employee, says BJP leader
content: The temple clerk had moved HC against the Malabar Devaswom Board‚Äôs order to spend funds to attend Global Ayyappa Sangamam

title: ‚ÄòBalti‚Äô movie review: Action papers over clich√©s and patchy writing
content: In ‚ÄòBalti,‚Äô starring Shane Nigam, Shanthnu Bhagyaraj, and Preethi Asrani, an unending stream of well-staged action sequences barely keeps afloat a plot lacking any novelty

title: Foundation stone laid for Periyar memorial in Alappuzha
content: The 1,141 sq ft memorial, designed in the model of a jail, will feature a statue of Periyar, a museum, a hall, a park, a garden, and other tourism-related projects

title: Businesses shut down because of law, online gaming companies tell Supreme Court
content: They seek urgent hearing and interim relief from the Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Act, 2025

title: Watch: ‚ÄòNational pride‚Äô MiG-21 flies through Indian skies for last time
content: The legendary Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-21 fighter jets, the backbone of the Indian Air Force‚Äôs combat fleet for more than six decades, streaked through Indian skies for the last time on Friday (September 26, 2025) ‚Äî its final adieu edged in history and many a remembrance.

title: Revenue staff boycott Ungaludan Stalin camps in Thanjavur
content: The unions have taken a stand that it will be impossible to resolve the issues raised at the greivance meeting within 45 days and wanted the government to remove the timelimit

title: Rahul Gandhi backs students protesting against Uttarakhand paper leak, calls BJP ‚Äòpaper chor‚Äô
content: The Congress leader alleged that ‚Äúthe ‚Äòpaper chors‚Äô know that even if the youth don‚Äôt get jobs, they will remain in power by stealing votes during elections‚Äù

title: 18 bonded labourers from TN among 23 rescued from brick kilns in Chittoor
content: The rescued eight families had been trapped in exploitative conditions in kilns for over a decade, the officials said

title: Hyderabad-based space tech startup Cosmoserve Space secures $3.17 million in pre-seed round¬†¬†
content: The startup is developing autonomous robotic spacecraft designed to address the global challenge of space debris

title: Kannada writer S.L. Bhyrappa cremated with State honours in Mysuru
content: Around 150 persons came from his native village Santeshivara in Hassan district to Mysuru to attend the funeral of Bhyrappa

title: Caste survey: CM asks officials to achieve daily progress rate of 10% to meet target, rules out extension of deadline
content: Since survey commenced on September 22, only 2.76 lakh families covered so far, which is less than 2% of the total 1.43 crore families in Karnataka

title: T.N. Congress demands Edappadi Palaniswami‚Äôs apology for remarks against its leader Selvaperunthagai
content: Party leaders in the Nilgiris called for action against Mr. Palaniswami, and demanded that the police ban his rallies until he offered an unconditional apology for his remarks

title: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk arrested in Leh
content: Internet service suspended in Leh; all schools and colleges have been closed till September 27 in Leh.

title: NIA invokes UAPA against father-son Maoist duo in Chhattisgarh BJP leader‚Äôs murder case
content: The duo was found to have been actively involved in the criminal conspiracy related to BJP leader Ratan Dubey's killing

title: DMK obsessed with publicity, ignoring noon meal scheme issues: Nainar Nagenthran
content: In a post on X, Mr. Nagenthran alleged that there were several discrepancies in the noon meal scheme implemented in government schools, including with respect to the quality of food.¬†

title: Tirumala Brahmotsavams transform into a tapestry of the country‚Äôs folk heritage
content: A total of 20 vibrant troupes comprising 557 artistes from nine States captivated thousands of pilgrims with their performances

title: Dulquer Salmaan moves Kerala High Court, challenges Customs seizure of high-end car
content: A Land Rover was seized from Dulquer Salmaan‚Äôs house in Kochi as part of crackdown on celebrities who reportedly purchased high-end used cars from Bhutan using forged documents

title: Need personal and professional integrity, transparency, adherence to rules: Neeraj Kumar Dohare, Sr. DGM of Central Railway
content: A seminar ‚ÄòVigilance: Our Shared Responsibility‚Äô was organised as part of preparations for Vigilance Awareness Week starting October 27.

title: Supreme Court defers Vodafone Idea plea against extra AGR demand to October 6
content: A Bench headed by CJI B.R. Gavai agreed to an oral request made by Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for DoT, to defer the hearing to October 6

title: In pictures | MiG-21 flies one last time
content: After over six decades in service, the Indian Air Force is formally retiring its last MiG-21 Bison jets.

title: Telangana ranks first in rainwater harvesting; 5.20 lakh works taken up in 2024-25
content: The rainwater harvesting initiative was spearheaded by Panchayat Raj and Rural Development Department with support from multiple departments, voluntary organisations and individuals

title: Allahabad HC junks Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs plea against Varanasi court orders on his remarks in U.S. on Sikh community
content: The order was challenged before the special MP/MLA sessions court which allowed the revision and remanded the matter to magisterial court to hear it afre

title: Celtics salute winning tradition with 'Gold Standard' City Edition uniforms
content: the uniform is dedicated to the Celtics' "timeless tradition of winning" the uniform features a white base accented with gold, with numbers and "Boston" also being featured with a gold swatch . the jersey is the first uniform in the franchise's history to not feature green .

title: How did Florida State turn things around so quickly?
content: "it was exciting and joyful. it was a beautiful scene," he says . he hopes to find his wife and daughter among the fans that had flooded the field like a tidal wave . the game, a decisive 31-17 win, provided a cathartic release from everything .

title: Wetzel: Mike Gundy dug in his heels and got left behind
content: the business of college football in 2025 is different from 2015. Direct revenue-sharing, NIL and the transfer portal have altered the way rosters are assembled . "you have to constantly reinvent, reinvest, reset, learn, grow. You change," says Dabo Swinney .

title: Ranking the 10 best players in the NBA for this season
content: the "NBA Today" crew discusses a preseason poll naming Nikola Jokic the best player in the NBA . our 2025 NBA Rank wraps up as we break down the final top 10 players in the league . we asked our expert panel to vote on player vs. player matchups .

title: College football betting: Can LSU hang with Ole Miss in Oxford?
content: this week 5 matchup comes down to identity and which team holds firm when pressure hits . the home team has covered in seven straight meetings in this series . one of two power 5 teams with a winning record as an undisclosed underdog .

title: MLB Power Rankings: Guardians rise, Mets and Tigers fall ahead of playoffs
content: the Tigers, Guardians, Mets, Reds and Diamondbacks fall into the playoffs . the Mets hold a slight one-game lead over Cincinnati and Arizona for the final wild-card spot . a late losing skid highlighted their second-half woes and put their playoff spot in the final .

title: New role, same grit: How Alyssa Thomas is having her best season -- in Year 12
content: Mercury's Alyssa Thomas kicks a 3-pointer against the Lynx . the Phoenix Mercury star lowered her right shoulder and banged into the basket . he grabbed one of Thomas' arms to prevent her from getting a shot up .

title: Oregon-Penn State, Bama-Georgia and 26 more to watch in college football's biggest week
content: the Crimson Tide travel to Georgia on friday night . it's the first trip to athens, Georgia, in a decade . resurgent Florida State visits a wonderfully surprising Virginia team . last week's merciless blowout of Illinois, Indiana hailed a harrowing victory .

title: Five reasons Daniel Jones has leveled up this season -- and one reason for concern
content: Daniel Jones is off to an excellent start in his first season with the Indianapolis Colts . he's the only player in the past 90 years with at least three rushing touchdowns, three passing touchdowns and no turnovers over the first three games of a season . Jones is the league leader in Total QBR (85.8) .

title: NBA Rank 2025: What league insiders say about the top 100
content: a preseason poll naming Nikola Jokic the best player in the NBA . we reached out to scouts, coaches and executives across the league to get their feedback on our new top 100 for 2025-26 . some of the biggest questions and points of contention from our latest edition of NBA Rank .

title: Seahawks hold off feisty Cardinals' comeback attempt
content: the Seahawks beat the Arizona Cardinals 23-20 thanks to a walk-off field goal . the game ended with a 23-20 win over the state farm stadium . their vaunted defense gave up 17 straight points, allowing Arizona to tie the score .
